definition: "Shiming", late Han dictionary, containing 1502 entries, using puns on the pronunciation of headwords to explain their meaning
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people

sentences.english: Chapter III is "Research methods used in Guang Ya Shu Zheng."
sentences.chinese: 第三章爲“《廣雅疏證》訓釋名物的方法。”

sentences.english: 'Shiming' is the first monograph about systematical etymological investment in ancient China.
sentences.chinese: 劉熙《釋名》是我國古代第一部系統探索語源的著作。

definition: "Erya" or "The Ready Guide", first extant Chinese dictionary, c. 3rd century BC, with glossaries on classical texts
Mr Gongyang's Annals or commentary on 春秋[Chun1 qiu1], early history, probably written by multiple authors during Han dynasty, same as 公羊春秋[Gong1 yang2 Chun1 qiu1]
see 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
Former Han dynasty (206 BC-8 AD), also called 西漢|西汉[Xi1 Han4], Western Han dynasty
Shuowen Jiezi, the original Han dynasty Chinese character dictionary with 10,516 entries, authored by Xu Shen 許慎|许慎[Xu3 Shen4] in 2nd century
Xu Xuan (-991), author of commentaries on Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字註|说文解字注[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4 Zhu4]
History of Zhou of the Northern Dynasties, twelfth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Linghu Defen 令狐德棻[Ling2 hu2 De2 fen1] in 636 during Tang Dynasty, 50 scrolls
Guangyun, Chinese rime dictionary 韻書|韵书[yun4 shu1] from 11th century, containing 26,194 single-character entries
falling tone/fourth tone in modern Mandarin
The School Sayings of Confucius (abbr. for 孔子家語|孔子家语[Kong3 zi3 Jia1 yu3])
Xu Shen (-147) the compiler of the original Han dynasty dictionary Shuowen Jiezi 說文解字|说文解字[Shuo1 wen2 Jie3 zi4]
Jiyun, Chinese rime dictionary with 53,525 single-character entries, published in 11th century
The Artificer's Record, a technology treaty compiled towards the end of the Spring and Autumn period
Wang Su (c. 195-256), classical scholar of Cao Wei dynasty, believed to have forged several classical texts
